com.google.enterprise.connector.spi
Interface Value

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleValue
public interface Value

A single, typed data item. The type can be obtained through the getType() call. Depending on the type, the appropriately typed getter should be called, as follows:

  • ValueType.STRING - getString() or getStream()
  • ValueType.BINARY - getStream()
  • ValueType.LONG - getLong()
  • ValueType.DOUBLE - getDouble()
  • ValueType.DATE - getDate()
  • ValueType.BOOLEAN - getBoolean()
If the type of the getter does not match the ValueType, then the implementation will attempt a conversion. If conversion is impossible, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

getStream

public java.io.InputStream getStream()
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                     RepositoryException
Get the value as a Stream. This is expected to be used with values of type ValueType.BINARY (particularly, for content). It will also work naturally for ValueType.STRING. Conversion is attempted for other types.

Returns:
The value as a Stream
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If conversion is impossible
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If getStream has already been called
RepositoryException
